text: Emmanuel Joseph Sieyès (3 May 1748 – 20 June 1836), usually known as the Abbé Sieyès was a French Roman Catholic abbé, clergyman, and political writer who was the chief political theorist of the French Revolution(1789–1799); he also held offices in the governments of the French Consulate (1799–1804) and the First French Empire (1804–1815). Category:1748 births Category:1836 deaths Category:French Roman Catholic priests Category:Recipients of the Order of the Legion of Honour Category:Presidents of the National Convention Category:Ambassadors of France
title: Emmanuel Joseph Sieyès
